image.altText: A SES rescue vehicle with flashing lights, travels down a snow-covered road amidst heavy snowfall and snow-laden trees.

props.synopsis: A woman is missing in floodwaters as parts of New South Wales prepare for another day of wild weather following heavy rain, wind and heavy snow.

title.children: Woman missing, 1,500 emergency call-outs amid NSW floods and snow

image.altText: Hamas militants

props.synopsis: Hamas says it will not lay down arms until "the establishment of an independent, fully sovereign Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital".

title.children: Hamas says it won't disarm without an independent Palestinian state

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian rally en route to Sydney University Gaza encampment

props.synopsis: Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed for hours on Sunday for a pro-Palestinian march which organisers have described as "historic", with authorities warning of disruptions to major roads and public transport.

title.children: What you need to know ahead of pro-Palestine march on Sydney Harbour Bridge

image.altText: Melting ice cream cone with US flag in the background and two sticks with Donald Trump's head with US flag sunglasses stuck in

props.synopsis: Returning to the US for the first time in four years, I found a country that didn't want to talk about politics, despite being in the eye of the Trump storm.

title.children: Trump's presidency is fast turning into one of the most consequential in decades

image.altText: A portait of Denise Bowden.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building on the federal government to remove funding from the Northern Territory government unless it meets outcomes on Indigenous incarceration.

title.children: 'No blank cheques': Pressure on federal government to pull territory funding

image.altText: Compilation of photos of men posing for camera with prominent photo of Richard Fidler in suit

props.synopsis: As a child, Richard Fidler was endlessly curious. That same thirst for understanding has guided him behind the Conversations mic, gently drawing captivating stories from his guests.

title.children: Richard Fidler's life in Conversations — from comedy rebel to beloved interviewer

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: The Queensland coroner describes the case of a baby — known to child safety authorities — who starved to death while his mother and her partner were on a drug binge as "utterly tragic".

title.children: Coroner won't hold inquest into baby who died while mum was on drugs

image.altText: Tadhg Beirne and Tom Curry of the British and Irish Lions clash with Nic White

props.synopsis: Nic White makes his presence felt for the last time as a Wallaby, while Max Jorgensen stuns the Lions for the second time this series. Here are the five quick hits from the third Test at Stadium Australia.

title.children: Five quick hits: Lightning causes havoc, Nic is white hot, and Max stuns again

image.altText: Two people embrace

props.synopsis: After a lacklustre start to the 2025 season, the Melbourne Vixens upset minor premiers West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final, 59-58.

title.children: Fairytale finish for Vixens coach after mid-season resignation

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.

title.children: Growing up on YouTube, gen-Zers say the ban is a blow to their 'culture'

image.altText: A close up of a man's face as he stands in front of a bush

props.synopsis: Together, a new body horror starring Alison Brie and Dave Franco, ignited a bidding war at this year's Sundance Film Festival. Now the world is finally being let in to Australian director Michael Shanks's sticky nightmare.

title.children: Australian director went to US to get noticed, sells film for $26m

image.altText: A woman in a black long-sleeved surf rashie with a blue boogie board under her arm at the beach.

props.synopsis: From Granny Grommets shredding waves on the Gold Coast to Fitzroy Fossils rowing their way into retirement, these ageing Aussies prove it's never too late to start fitness and fun.

title.children: Secret to ageing well for these Aussies is 'wearing out' not 'rusting out'

image.altText: Young woman with hair down wearing patterned blazer, sitting in well-lit room.

props.synopsis: Lies are circulating on social media, AI chatbots are being manipulated. Hannah Ferguson and Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Ressa reflect on the dangers of disinformation, and why it can lead to real-world violence.

title.children: Lies and big tech algorithms can lead to real-world violence

image.altText: GettyImages-2227452828

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister claims silver behind Katie Ledecky in what is being described as the "race of the century".

title.children: Pallister claims silver in 'race of the century' at world champs

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Back again, I see. Haven't you been humiliated enough?

title.children: You better believe I'm here to judge you. Let's play… HARD!

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration quietly reversed a policy that tightened restrictions on microchip exports to China, but why the sudden backflip?

title.children: Has Trump just given China a leg-up in the AI arms race?

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera seated in a garden

props.synopsis: For most people, a package delivered to their homes is usually welcomed but for people experiencing domestic violence, alcohol delivery is "like the guided missile that is the match".

title.children: Former Neighbours star urges changes to alcohol delivery laws

image.altText: Old picture of Peter Falconio (left) at his graduation with girlfriend Joanne Lees (right)

props.synopsis: Bradley John Murdoch's death is not enough to quash the goal of finding Peter Falconio’s remains and delivering answers to his family, a cold case forensics expert says.

title.children: After his killer's death, the search for a backpacker's body continues

image.altText: Oscar Piastri celebrates victory, standing on his car, helmet still on, raising his arms in the air

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri is chasing a seventh grand prix win in 2025, and a second consecutive Hungarian Grand Prix triumph. Here is what you need to know about the Hungarian Grand Prix.

title.children: F1 Hungarian Grand Prix: How to watch, what time does it start?

image.altText: Logan Morris gestures to the crowd in celebration while teammates and opponents react behind him

props.synopsis: Brisbane underlines its premiership credentials with an impressive 27-point win over Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Lions make a statement with imperious MCG win over Magpies

image.altText: An NRL player gets carries the ball surrounded by other players.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters beat Manly 20-4 in wet and wild conditions at Brookvale Oval, after the Dragons stun the table-topping Raiders.

title.children: Roosters score another try of the year contender in the wet against Manly

image.altText: Jessica Cottis in the midst of conducting an orchestra, dressed in all black with her hair tied back in a ponytail.

props.synopsis: Musicians share their experience of what it's like living with synaesthesia, including how they manage this wonderful, sometimes overwhelming multi-sensory experience.

title.children: For people with synaesthesia, music can evoke more than goosebumps

image.altText: A young girl sqauts in the dirt next to a fire of burning plastics that is heating a metal kettle.

props.synopsis: After fleeing Afghanistan, more than 1.8 million people have been forced to return to a country in the grip of economic collapse and draconian restrictions, especially for women.

title.children: They fled Afghanistan for a better life. Now they're being forced back

image.altText: An elderly man looks down the barrel of the lense as he leans on a fence with a bull in the background.

props.synopsis: The first time Roger Kneipp attended his local bull sale he was just a baby in a pram. Now 80 years old, he has seen the history of the industry play out.

title.children: Eighty years of bull sales drives breeder's love affair with Herefords

image.altText: Man looks at stock prices

props.synopsis: Weaker-than-expected US economic data and another round of US reciprocal tariffs have roiled global financial markets.

title.children: 'Perfect storm' points to US recession and RBA interest rate cuts

image.altText: A screenshot from the video game Rugby League 26 featuring a player from the NRLW competition.

props.synopsis: After a launch mired by bugs, server outages and criticism around player likenesses, Rugby League 26 video game developer Ross Symons defends his company and says unhappy players "should know better".

title.children: Developer of criticised rugby league video game says unhappy players 'should know better'

image.altText: A baby bird with fluffy feathers sits in a human hand.

props.synopsis: The estimated population of the black-tailed godwit has declined as much as 77.5 per cent in 23 years, with fears for its survival in the near future.

title.children: Bird that flies 10,000km each year to Australia listed as endangered

image.altText: A curator at the Australian War Memorial displaying the old bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: When best mates Stanley Lewis and Frederick Hume enlisted to serve in World War II, a publican in the NSW town of Wingham gave them a gift they would never be able enjoy together.

title.children: The tragic reason why this 80yo bottle of beer has never been drunk

image.altText: A woman scores a try in wet conditions during an NRLW match

props.synopsis: The NRLW's first-ever Magic Round is underway in Newcastle, but the opening day has been marred by torrential downpours that have delayed matches.

title.children: 'Couldn't see the ball': Wild weather hits inaugural NRLW Magic Round

image.altText: A man with walking sticks on a snowy mountain.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hutchinson says a school scholarship "fundamentally changed his life". He is now trekking across the US to give underprivileged kids the same opportunity.

title.children: 'Scruffy' kid who became surgeon thanks to scholarship treks to fund more

image.altText: Two SES workers wearing orange uniforms, searching through a grassy landscape.

props.synopsis: The search for missing Alice Springs man Gach Top has been suspended after five days, after police and the SES sought local advice from trail guides and family friends.

title.children: Police suspend search for missing 26yo man Gach Top in Red Centre

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit stares off camera.

props.synopsis: The final seat of Bass has been decided, two weeks after the Tasmanian state election — with a veteran physician who is staunchly opposed to the proposed Hobart AFL stadium to take his place as an MP.

title.children: Independent opponent to Hobart stadium wins in final Tasmanian seat

image.altText: crime scene

props.synopsis: Police launch a murder investigation after the man was unable to be saved by emergency services in the inner Brisbane suburb of West End.

title.children: Murder probe launched after 50yo man dies in inner-Brisbane unit

image.altText: Two 20-something women and a middle-aged man hold up a clapper board that says 'Optics'

props.synopsis: We don't want to brag but the ABC has received 44 Logie nominations this year. From deep-dive documentaries to side-splitting comedies, it would be selfish of us not to share these ABC gems for your viewing pleasure.

title.children: From big laughs to bold stories, the ABC's Logie-nominated shows are ready to binge
